required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of NBI-98854 in Adults With Tourette Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of NBI-98854 in Adult Subjects With Tourette Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 2, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to assess the safety and efficacy of NBI-98854 administered once daily (qd) for a total of 8 weeks of treatment. This study will enroll approximately 90 male and female subjects clinically diagnosed with Tourette Syndrome.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in the YGTSS TTS
primary_outcome.description: The YGTSS is designed to rate the overall severity of motor and phonic tic symptoms across a range of dimensions: number, frequency, intensity, complexity, and interference. The YGTSS was administered by the investigator (or qualified designee) using a computer-based structured clinical interview. The TTS is the sum of the 5 motor tic items and the 5 phonic (vocal) tic items and ranges from 0 to 50, with higher scores representing greater severity

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression of Change Tourette Syndrome (CGI-TS)-Improvement Score at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-TS-Improvement scale is used to assess overall improvement since the initiation of study drug dosing on a 7-point scale. Each of the CGI-TS-Improvement response categories was assigned a numerical score as follows: 1 = Very much improved; 2 = Much improved; 3 = Minimally improved; 4 = Not changed; 5 = Minimally worse; 6 = Much worse; 7 = Very much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in the Clinical Global Impression of Tics (CGI-Tics)-Severity Score
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-Tics-Severity scale is used to assess overall severity on a 7-point scale. Each of the CGI-Tics-Severity response categories was assigned a numerical score as follows: 1 = Normal, not at all ill; 2 = Borderline ill; 3 = Mildly ill; 4 = Moderately ill; 5 = Markedly ill; 6 = Severely ill; 7 = Among the most extremely ill patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Last Visit in the Rush Video-based Tic Rating Scale (RTRS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: A modified RTRS was used in this study that includes short video recordings to measure 5 tic variables: number of body areas affected, frequency of motor and phonic tics, and severity of motor and phonic tics. The RTRS total score is calculated as the sum of the 5 domain scores, and ranges from 0 to 20, with higher scores representing greater severity. The final on-treatment visit was used in subjects who discontinued prior to Week 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in the YGTSS Global Tic Severity Score
secondary_outcome.description: The YGTSS Global Tic Severity score is the sum of the YGTSS TTS and the YGTSS Impairment score and ranges from 0 to 100, with higher scores representing greater severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 8 in the Premonitory Urge for Tics Scale (PUTS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The PUTS is an instrument for quantifying the premonitory urge phenomena associated with tics. It consists of 9 items, each of which is scored on a 4-point scale (1=not at all true, 2=a little true, 3=pretty much true, 4=very much true). The PUTS total score is calculated as the sum of the scores for the 9 items. The maximum possible total score is 36.

arm_group.description: Placebo administered once daily for 8 weeks
Fixed dose administered once daily for 8 weeks
Fixed dose administered once daily for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Have a clinical diagnosis of Tourette Syndrome (TS)
2. Have at least moderate tic severity
3. Have TS symptoms that impair school, occupational, and/or social function
4. If using maintenance medication(s) for TS or TS spectrum diagnoses (e.g. obsessive-compulsive disorder [OCD], Attention-Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder [ADHD]), be on stable doses
5. Be in good general health
6. Have a negative urine drug screen for amphetamines, barbiturates, benzodiazepine, phencyclidine, cocaine, or opiates, and a negative alcohol screen
7. Subjects of childbearing potential who do not practice total abstinence must agree to use hormonal or two forms of nonhormonal contraception (dual contraception) consistently during the screening, treatment and follow-up periods of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Have an active, clinically significant unstable medical condition within 1 month prior to screening
2. Have a known history of long QT syndrome or cardiac tachy-arrhythmia
3. Have a known history of neuroleptic malignant syndrome
4. Have a cancer diagnosis within 3 years prior to screening (some exceptions allowed)
5. Have an allergy, hypersensitivity, or intolerance to VMAT2 inhibitors
6. Have a known history of substance dependence, substance (drug) or alcohol abuse
7. Have a significant risk of suicidal or violent behavior
8. Are currently pregnant or breastfeeding
9. Have initiated Comprehensive Behavioral Intervention for Tics (CBIT) during the screening period or at baseline or plan to initiate CBIT during the study
10. Have received an investigational drug within 30 days before screening or plan to use an investigational drug (other than NBI-98854) during the study
11. Have a blood loss â‰¥550 mL or donated blood within 30 days prior to screening

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study enrolled participants (male and female) with a diagnosis of Tourette Syndrome through Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th or 5th Editions (DSM-IV or -V) from approximately 40 study centers in the United States

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered once daily for 8 weeks

group.title: NBI-98854 40 mg
group.description: Fixed dose of NBI-98854 40 mg administered once daily for 8 weeks

group.title: NBI-98854 80 mg
group.description: NBI-98854 80 mg dose will be titrated in a blinded fashion (subjects will receive 40 mg for the first week followed by 80 mg for the remainder of the 8-week treatment period)

baseline.population: the intent-to-treat (ITT) analysis set, that includes all randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study drug, have postbaseline safety data & have at least one post randomization Yale Global Tic Severity Scale (YGTSS) Total Tic Score (TTS) value at a scheduled visit or mapped early termination (ET) visit during 8-week treatment period

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Yale Global Tic Severity Scale (YGTSS) Total Tic Score (TTS)
measure.description: The YGTSS is designed to rate the overall severity of motor and phonic tic symptoms across a range of dimensions: number, frequency, intensity, complexity, and interference. The YGTSS was administered by the investigator (or qualified designee) using a computer-based structured clinical interview. The TTS is the sum of the 5 motor tic items and the 5 phonic (vocal) tic items and ranges from 0 to 50, with higher scores representing greater severity

outcome.description: The PUTS is an instrument for quantifying the premonitory urge phenomena associated with tics. The PUTS total score is calculated as the sum of the scores for the 9 items. The maximum possible total score is 36.
outcome.population: The analysis population include intent-to-treat (ITT):all subjects in the safety analysis set with at least one post-randomization TTS value reported at a scheduled visit or mapped Early Termination (ET) visit during the treatment period.

reported_events.desc: All TEAEs,whether observed by investigator,reported by subject,noted from lab. findings,or identified by other means, were recorded from time subject signed ICF until subjectâ€™s follow-up visit(Week 10 or ET). The analysis set include all subjects who are randomized to a treatment group and dispensed study drug, with two exclusions:(a)subjects who withdraw from study & return all previously dispensed study drug with all doses present,&(b) subjects who have no postbaseline safety data collected.

event.description: The Organ system term used to generate the source table is General disorders and administration site conditions

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Generally, the PI has the right to publish results provided such publication does not violate confidentiality or IP provisions within the contract with the Sponsor. Prior to submission for publication or presentation of results, the PI must provide the Sponsor time for review. The Sponsor can request the PI to withhold or remove information from all publications. For a multi-center study, any publication of results by the PI shall not be made before the first multi-center publication.
